it.azraelsec.Protocol

Class Communication

  • java.lang.Object
    • it.azraelsec.Protocol.Communication

  • public class Communication
extends java.lang.Object
    The Communication class encapsulates all the logic related to the communication protocol used to exchange commands and their execution results in a solid way.

    The underline protocol is based on a request/response logic: the Client makes a request using a proper Commands, the Server looks for a related handler and execute it. After that, the handler itself, sends the result back using the same approach: using the SUCCESS and FAILURE values from the Commands enumeration.

    Each method below, before to send the raw data over TCP connection, checks for formal error in the parameters' kind and number, so that can be thrown a proper Exception.

    The underlining logic is simple: every data is sent through the TCP socket in a raw format, using byte direct representation. When a String data is sent, before is stored an Integer representing its size. This way, the receive can deduce how many bytes it needs to load from the input buffer to reconstruct the original String information.

    Author:
    Federico Gerardi, https://azraelsec.github.io/

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static void readFileFromSocket(java.io.DataInputStream inputStream, java.io.OutputStream stream)
      Reads a file from a DataInputStream using the same approach used for the String objects transferring, so sending the buffer size before as an integer data type.
      static void receive(java.io.DataInputStream inputStream, java.io.DataOutputStream outputStream, java.util.Map<Commands,Execution> dispatcher)
      Receives a Commands requests, handles it using the dispatcher pointed out as argument and sends the result back through a Commands instance.
      static void receiveAndSendStream(java.io.DataInputStream inputStream, java.io.DataOutputStream outputStream, java.io.InputStream tosendStream)
      Receives a Commands and sends a stream back.
      static void send(java.io.DataOutputStream outputStream, java.io.DataInputStream inputStream, Handler onSuccess, Handler onFailure, Commands command, java.lang.Object... args)
      Requests a Commands execution and waits to receive its result back.
      static void sendAndReceiveStream(java.io.DataOutputStream outputStream, java.io.DataInputStream inputStream, Handler onSuccess, java.io.OutputStream stream, Handler onFailure, Commands command, java.lang.Object... args)
      It sends a Commands which represents the action We would like to request and waits for a resulting data stream.

      • sendAndReceiveStream

        public static void sendAndReceiveStream(java.io.DataOutputStream outputStream,
                                        java.io.DataInputStream inputStream,
                                        Handler onSuccess,
                                        java.io.OutputStream stream,
                                        Handler onFailure,
                                        Commands command,
                                        java.lang.Object... args)
        It sends a Commands which represents the action We would like to request and waits for a resulting data stream.

        It is useful to read file, which can be streamed without the necessity to know in advance the streamed data size.

        Parameters:
        outputStream - requester output stream
        inputStream - requester input stream
        onSuccess - Commands#SUCCESS handler
        stream - output stream
        onFailure - Commands#FAILURE handler
        command - Commands to execute
        args - command arguments
